fields.value: Expenditure and Employment Data for the Criminal Justice System [United States]:  CJEE Extracts File, 1983

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: These criminal justice expenditure and employment (CJEE)  data are taken from a special compilation of sources available from  the Census Bureau's Annual Surveys of Governments, Finance Statistics  and Employment Statistics. Levels of government covered are federal,  state, county, municipal, and towns and townships. Information is  included on total employment, total police protection, police  protection with arrest powers, other police protection, judicial-legal  employment, corrections employment, total expenditures, police  protection expenditures, judicial-legal expenditures, and corrections  expenditures. Types of expenditures include direct current, capital  outlay, equipment, and intergovernmental. Types of employment include total, full-time, part-time, and full-time equivalent.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

seriesName.value: Expenditure and Employment Data for the Criminal Justice System Series

value: United States Bureau of the Census's Annual Surveys of Governments, Finance Statistics and Employment Statistics
All federal, state, and local governments in the United States.

fields.value: Larger governments were selected with certainty. Smaller  governments were selected using probability sampling based on a ratio  of governmental expenditures or indebtedness to the total expenditures and indebtedness of all noncertainty governments in specified groups.
